page.title: 02Farming.
page.content: The farms in this area are small, the largest being 56 acres. They mainly grow flowers(early daffodils, narcissi and soleil d'or being specialities) and potatoes. The fields are small in strips protected from the strong winds and winter gales by tall hedges of pittisporam and escallonia. There are some dairy and beef cows along with a few pigs, goats and poultry. As the sea surrounds this area there are several small lobster, crawfish and crab fishermen. There are three or four small local trawlers which catch hake,whiting,plaice,turbot dogfish,monkfish,skate,ray and gurnard. In recent years, some of the Cornish trawlers have come in search of fish.
